Estonia: Whole Estonia was included in Russian empire.
India: Sikh army under Banda Singh Bahadur defeats Mughal Empire in the Battle of Chappar Chiri and establishes Sikh rule from Lahore to Delhi.
Latvia: Riga fell to the Russians, though Courland remained under the control of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth.
Malta: First grant in favour of locals (including a woman) of a title of nobility to have been created by the Grand Masters. On 24 December 1710, Grand Master Perellos granted the title of Baron of Gomerino jointly to Paolo and Beatrice Testaferrata.
Russia: The Russian guberniyas were divided into lots according to noble population. Russo-Turkish War (1710–1711): Charles XII of Sweden persuaded the Ottoman sultan to declare war on Russia.
Sweden: Battle of Helsingborg: final failed attempt by Denmark to regain Scania
